title: The Colorful, Blossoming D.C. Arts Scene In The 1950s, '60s
teaser: In 1965 the work of six local painters went on exhibit at the now-defunct Washington Gallery of Modern Art. The show launched a movement, and the painters' work now hangs in major museums. One of those artists, now 97, lives in Arlington, Va.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
